extendedIngredients.name: rice wine
extendedIngredients.original: 1 Tbs. good-quality Chinese rice wine or dry sherry
extendedIngredients.originalName: good-quality Chinese rice wine or dry sherry

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breast
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb. fresh skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut in cubes, nuggets, or shreds; or 1 lb. shrimp or scallops (or a combination), shrimp butterflied, scallops halved if large
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut in cubes, nuggets, or shreds; or 1 lb. shrimp or scallops (or a combination), shrimp butterflied, scallops halved if large
meta: cut in cubes, nuggets, or shreds; or 1 lb. shrimp or scallops (or a combination), shrimp butterflied, scallops  if large

extendedIngredients.name: water
extendedIngredients.original: 4 cups water (for velveting in water) or 3 to 4 cups corn, peanut, or canola oil (for velveting in oil)
extendedIngredients.originalName: water (for velveting in water) or 3 to 4 cups corn, peanut, or canola oil (for velveting in oil)

title: Velveted Chicken Or Shrimp
summary: Velveted Chicken Or Shrimp might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains roughly 193g of protein, 24g of fat, and a total of 1136 calories. This gluten free and dairy free recipe serves 1 and costs $8.6 per serving. Head to the store and pick up chicken breast, cornstarch, egg white, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the water you could follow this main course with the Watermelon-Peach Slushies as a dessert. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is pretty good. Try Velveted Chicken Stir Fry, Marinated Velveted Chicken for Stir-Fry, and Chicken and Shrimp Jambalaya for similar recipes.
instructions: In a mini food processor, blend the egg white, salt, wine, and cornstarch until thick and smooth, about 2 minute. Or mix the ingredients by hand, smoothing lumps with your fingers and beating with a fork to thicken slightly.    With your hands, toss the chicken or fish with the marinade to evenly coat and separate the pieces. Cover with plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes or overnight.    In a wok or stir-fry pan, bring the water to a steaming, near simmer, or bring the oil to the slow-fry stage, 275F on a deep-fry thermometer. Next to the stove, set a plate big enough to hold the fish or chicken in a single layer. Have a large Chinese mesh skimmer at hand.    Toss the chicken or fish once more and slide it into the hot water or oil, leaving any excess marinade behind. Stir gently with chopsticks to separate the pieces. Watch carefully to see when the outside turns 95% white, 5 to 10 seconds for shreds or tiny cubes, 30 to 45 seconds for larger nuggets. Scoop out the food promptly with the mesh spoon and quickly spread it on the plate.          Rate this Recipe and View Reviews

Or mix the ingredients by hand, smoothing lumps with your fingers and beating with a fork to thicken slightly.    With your hands, toss the chicken or fish with the marinade to evenly coat and separate the pieces. Cover with plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes or overnight.    In a wok or stir-fry pan, bring the water to a steaming, near simmer, or bring the oil to the slow-fry stage, 275F on a deep-fry thermometer. Next to the stove, set a plate big enough to hold the fish or chicken in a single layer. Have a large Chinese mesh skimmer at hand.    Toss the chicken or fish once more and slide it into the hot water or oil, leaving any excess marinade behind. Stir gently with chopsticks to separate the pieces. Watch carefully to see when the outside turns 95% white, 5 to 10 seconds for shreds or tiny cubes, 30 to 45 seconds for larger nuggets. Scoop out the food promptly with the mesh spoon and quickly spread it on the plate.
